39426679.review:
Note: You should definitely play the other free games in this "series" (Cube Escape) before playing this, otherwise the game will be missing some lore/context that makes it all the more interesting!

This is the first of three (so far) premium games by Rusty Lake and I really enjoyed it! The puzzles were for the most part just the right level of difficulty with a few less intuitive parts that I ended up looking at the walkthrough to figure out. The music and atmosphere matches that of other Rusty Lake games and it's easy to get drawn in. If you're looking for a surreal, morbid puzzle point and click, this game is for you!

39424210.review:
The music and voice acting drew me right into this game's haunting atmosphere. The puzzle part was secondary for me because I really wanted to know more about the mysterious world of Rusty Lake. It's a bare bones but creepy story that leaves you with some questions that make you want to see more in the next installment.
About the puzzles, they were clever and were worked into the scenes in ways that fit the story very well. I wish some of them weren't quite so absorbing because that slowed down the pacing and broke some of the immersion. I found myself just looking up some of the answers because I wanted to get on with it, but I'm not a puzzle gamer so take that with a grain of salt. I really enjoyed the mystery of this game.

39287669.review: Incredibly morbid little point and click. No jumpscares, no psychological horrors that will come back at you later - but morbid none the less. The puzzles are interesting and are MOSTLY encapsulated in the guest rooms you decide to enter. It is a short game, my 3.3 hours was a complete play through and a half but the bundle with the other Rusty Lake games is definitely worth it.  If you pay attention, the game will tell you whose room to try next, but of course it's one of those things you really only see after your second or third play through. My only complaint, a minor one, is the yield from various couplings of items is not always intuitive. IE pulling rosemary off of an antler.

39146672.review:
[b]Rusty Lake Hotel 3/5:[/b] [i]Prostřeno!: The Videogame[/i]... Skoro. Koncept totiž není zase až tak rozdílný. Pětice hostů, pětice hodnocených večeří, pětice zábavných aktivit před nimi. To vše ve svébytném antropomorfně-makabrózním vizuálním hávu.

 Žánrově jde spíše o (ne)dějem zastřešené flashové puzzle minihry (ostatně kořeny titulu jsou v sérii free netových miniher) než adventuru s puzzle elementy. Což problém není; speciálně když vezmeme v potaz, že zdejší puzzly jsou rozmanité i nápadité. Jenže, bohužel, také lehké. Navíc jich není příliš (pět místností a v každé cca pět puzzlů), což se rovná nulové výzvě a rychlému dohrání. Vejdete se pod dvě hodiny i pokud budete cílit na plné ohodnocení veškerých svých pokrmů. 

 Jde tedy o zvláštní mix hry, která svým stylem i zaměřením cílí na značně specifické publikum, které si rádo se svou večeří nejprve pohraje, ale zároveň tomuto úzkému publiku předkládá hratelnost určenou spíše nehráčům, kteří hledají relax během obědové pauzy. Není to rozhodně zlé ani špatné, ale je to nedotažené a potenciál z toho sice bezpečně rozpoznáte, ale naprosto není zúročen. To se povedlo až v (ne)pokračování [i]Rusty Lake: Roots[/i], které je více narativně provázané, nabízí ještě lepší puzzly, trochu větší výzvu i o jeden či dva chlupy delší herní dobu. 
------------------------------------------------------------------

39143934.review:
Rust Lake사 시리즈 물인 Rust Lake Hotel
포인트 앤 클릭을 이용한 퍼즐 어드 벤쳐이다.

그래픽과 사운드는 평이하지만, 
특유의 기괴하고 섬뜩한 분위기가 특징이다.

스토리를 진행하기 위한 퍼즐은 합리적이고 직관적으로 제시 되어 적절한 난이도이지만
도전과제인 음식 재료 구하는 파트에서는 다소 직관적이지도 합리적이지도 않다.
병아리를 전기 고문하면, 입에서 재료가 튀어나온 다는건....  좀;;

시리즈물 중 하나 이므로 앞뒤의 내용을 알지 못하면 이해하기 힘들다고는 하나,
그래도 한 게임 안에서의 기승전결은 있어야지, 대체 이건 무슨 내용인지 알 수가 없다.

2200원의 싼 가격이지만 솔직히 아깝다.
퍼즐 '도'  좋아하고, 세일 '도'  한다면 사서 플레이 해보는 것도 괜찮다.

39045091.review:
作为解谜游戏，流程短了一些而难度也偏低。就算不看攻略两三个小时也享用完毕了。但这种手绘风格着实很吸引人，另外因为个人缘故，很喜欢这种类似马男波杰克的兽首人身的设定。有种说不出的神秘感与预言感。
  特别喜欢一些场景画面，像是黑夜与白天的转化湖水颜色的改变，乌鸦渡船五个客人坐在湖中心的小船上面对生死未卜的前途，末了侦探坐水下电梯回到锈湖旅馆，四周是尘封的记忆。
  就算没有这一切，光是那孤独伫立在湖中心的小旅馆也让人心驰神往，哪怕不惜生命前往探视也是值得的啊。

39041785.review:
Welcome to the Rusty Lake again. Why don't you make a stay in this amazing hotel? The price is really low - your life, memories and probably soul. 
Make sure the guests will be in a good condition so they will taste good on the dinner table. Another psychedelic puzzle from Rusty Lake. With wider variety of puzzle types, sweet music, pretty visuals - well, you know, everything's okay.

Just to be honest - aquiring optional ingridients for boar and pigeon wasn't really interesting. Unlike other ingridients that required attention, these two required repeating certain actions without any actual hints on what to do. Had to look in the walkthrough for them. But the game is good anyway.

38973280.review:
系列第七作，也是锈湖系列第一作(前缀不同，并非逃离方块系列)。时间线1893年，主角是还不是鹦鹉的Harvey，在锈湖旅馆当侍应生。
尽管作为冒险系列的第一作，玩法上和逃离方块并没有太大差异。虽然可以选择每天要杀的客人，但追求三星的话就必须按顺序来(每天进客房前都先想办法拿到一个食材，据此决定顺序)。
剧情上，开场就告诉你这是Mr.Owl的旅馆。他招待了五个客人，而每晚都会让Harvey杀掉一个制作晚餐，客人们的记忆则是被提取到了黑色方块之中。最后Harvey点完了那些黑色方块后，就会看到前作(case23)中沉入湖底的侦探Dale又乘坐电梯被送上地面。之后似乎就是下一作(birthday)的剧情了，顺带一提，满星奖励的密码似乎也会用在birthday之中。不过这边时间线有点错乱的样子，毕竟侦探沉入湖底发生在1972年，疑惑中(⊙o⊙)
最后，还是给锈湖打call！走过路过不要错过啦！锈湖出品，必属精品！

38681354.review: This is a fantastic room escape game with a twisted, creepy atmosphere.  It's disturbing in an innocent-turns-dark Tim Burton kind of way, but with its own look.  I basically played it three times because I lost a save file (thanks to it being a Flash game) and then because I failed to make note of something that wasn't really worth the third play-through to get, considering there's little replay value.  It's totally possible to do in one sitting of less than two hours without hints, but the brevity is made up for by the low price and the fact that the world is also present in (at this time) nine free mobile games of the same style.  Totally worth it if you like puzzle-based point-and-click injected with style.

[list]

38553794.review:
Dieses Spiel ist.... merkwürdig. Allerdings auf eine gute Art merkwürdig. Die rätzel sind knackig und manchmal muss man etwas um die Ecke denken, aber nicht übertrieben schwer, wenn man das Prinzip verstanden hat. Es ist dem Spieler überlassen, in welcher Reihenfolge er welches Level spielt, allerdings muss man eine bestimmte Reihenfolge einhalten, um wirklich alles zu 100% richtig zu machen, was den Wiederspielwert erhöht. Kleiner Kritikpunkt von meiner Seite ist der Mangel an Story. man findet nicht so wirklich heraus, warum passiert was passiert und das Ende habe ich ehrlich gesagt absolut nicht verstanden. 
anzumerken ist noch, dass das Spiel in Flash programiert ist. Am Anfang etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber an sich tut das dem Spiel letztendlich keinen Abbruch.

38296305.review: So this was a pretty short game, but I think it's worth it for a couple of reasons. To begin with, you think you know how its going to end before you really even begin, but you don't. There are definitely surprises and twists along the way. It's dark and creepy and odd but fascinating and challenging. I had trouble with some of the puzzles, but I think they were all manageable. Even though it's a puzzle game that's short I would say it has decent replay value if you wait a bit. Also, the art was great. I would recommend this to people who like point and click games, puzzles, horror themes, and mildly disturbing content.

Хм, даже не знаю с чего начать... 
Это квест. Квест с красивой рисовкой, приятной музыкой и интересным сюжетом *очень расплывчато, но так не хочется спойлерить*.
Каждый день вам нужно предоставить изумительно вкусный ужин, для которого понадобятся определенные ингридиенты. Ингридиенты ищутся в самых неожиданных местах и только в одной из комнат постояльца. Скажу что последовательность комнат не имеет никакого отношения к дням сервировки блюда, так что можно пройти несколько раз, дабы получить все 3 звезды. :)
Мы проходили с парнем, и да, так веселее, когда кто-то рядом сидит и предлагает "места" для поиска (они реально странные:D).
P.S. Не открывайте правое окно, пока не возьмете баночку (именно баночку). Иначе рестарт :(.

37836881.review: This is a strange one. Perhaps the setting is familiar to those who have played other Rusty Lake games, but this was a first for me. The characters are all anthropomorphic critters but this fact can largely be ignored, e.g. Mr. Boar looks like a boar, but the story proceeds as if he were human. I say [u] largely[/u] can be ignored because the fact that the hotel guests are animals does play one important part in the story, the details of which would be a spoiler. Suffice to say that the player is going to be doing some . . . unpleasant things to complete the game. Quirky setting and artwork aside, this is a point-and-click adventure game based around an episodic series of puzzles. I found it entertaining enough, though not outstanding. It is quite short and can be completed in a couple of hours, plus another hour to wrap up the optional puzzles. My game time is misleading as it includes 10-11 hours that the game was left running.

36311946.review:
Sendo curto e grosso: este é um joguinho de puzzles em Flash. Literalmente. Não que isso desmereça o jogo. Machinarium é em Flash e é uma obra prima. Esse aqui é bem barato é verdade, e o que me atraiu nele foi o plotzinho sombrio. 

Você leva para um hotel 5 hóspedes que vão aos poucos sendo transformados em pratos principais para os hóspedes que vão sobrando. Cada um que você tem que matar para virar ingrediente culinário está em um quarto que é uma legítima "escape room". Você só pode sair quando tiver o ingrediente principal, que no caso é o hóspede. Os puzzles são legaizinhos, alguns meio sem pé nem cabeça, mas praticamente nada que não seja decifrável pra quem tem alguma experiência com jogos deste tipo.

O que ocorre é que você faz os 5 pratos e ganha as 5 chaves (1 pra cada hóspede) pra supostamente desvendar algo no final. Só que nada é desvendado. A história fica em aberto (ou eu que não tive capacidade pra entender, vai saber). 

Simplificando: o próprio site do desenvolvedor tem outros games em Flash no mesmíssimo estilo, só que de graça. Se quiser dar um troco pra ajudar o desenvolvedor, vá em frente, mas não espere nada muito mais elaborado do que você encontra no site deles.

NOTA: 6/10

Got both Rusty Lake games on the cheap. Tone is good, story is intruiging, and the art's nice enough, but the gameplay really falls flat. There's a handful of decent puzzles in there, and the main 'ingredients' are fun enough to find, but a lot of the optional ones are just daft; at least one of them literally just has you clicking on the same object a buch of times until it appears, with no indication. 36179915.review:
Escape room puzzle game. Really bizarre narrative about murdering animals and feeding their meat to other animals. Not really sure what the point was. Never heard of the game before but it was on sale for Halloween, and I thought it might be a bizarre, interesting game. 

It certainly is, but aparently this is a series of games, many of which are not marketed on Steam. Thus, I have the same/similar problem with this game as I did Lisa - this is not an overly privvy title to bring on newcomers. The ending to the game was entirely unsatisfactory and basically told me to enter a code in to one of their other titles to get some more story. 

So why am I recommending this? Simple. At it's core, it's a weird, macabre "escape the room" game that's $2 regular price. Strictly as a puzzle game, it's entertaining. Some people think the puzzles are really obtuse or impossible to figure out. I would politely disagree with that. There are certainly some parts in each room that can leave you scratching your head, but all of the puzzles are DEFINITELY attainable without any sort of guide. Because of this, the game is worth the $2 price tag. 

Also, don't let the hours played fool you. I left the game on for at least 3 hours while I went off to do something else. Depending on how much difficulty you have with the puzzles, I'd say the gameplay is 1-2 hours.

To sum up, it's a cheap bit of puzzle entertainment with a weird twist a lot of puzzle games don't have. The story is not really there and the ending feels more like what you might see on a Saturday morning serial cartoon rather than a fully fleshed out end. But it kept me entertained and I wasn't bored or frustrated, to its credit, so I would recommend this.

- Typos aplenty in the dialogue
- I don't personally care for the art style

* A poor introduction to the series for newcomers

This review will contain mild spoilers for the premise of the game.

You work at the Rusty Lake Hotel. Presumably. Who you are or what your name is never gets established. Your only job, apparently, is killing off the guests one by one and serving them for dinner the next day. Why? Who knows.

Rusty Lake Hotel was the first commercial entry for a longrunning series of free games. This was my first foray into Rusty Lake's setting, so it's possible those who have prior experience with the games might better understand what's happening. Still, just the tiniest of hints about what's going on, to make the game more accessible to newcomers, would have been quite welcome.

The lack of guidance extends to the gameplay as well. The puzzles in Rusty Lake Hotel can be as surreal as its setting. Sometimes that works, forcing you to think outside the box in novel ways. Sometimes it really doesn't. I frequently had to use the built-in walkthrough to get through a chapter.

Let me give you an example how how obtuse the puzzles can get. In one chapter, I got stuck trying to find tabasco sauce so I could make an anthropomorphized deer his drink. (Yes, the entire game is that weird.) The solution? Click on the antlers of the deer skull mounted on the wall until tabasco sauce runs from its nose. [i] Of course. [/i]

There's barely a plot to speak of, either. Not only do you not know why you're murdering all these guests, they themselves don't appear to care. Each morning, if you choose to click on the remaining characters, they recite the exact same line as they did on the first day. None of them ever comment on the way their numbers are dwindling. Killing them barely affected me, because they didn't feel the slightest bit like people, just cartoon props.

TL;DR: I'd advise those interested to skip straight to Rusty Lake Roots instead. You'll get similar puzzles with a better storyline.

35458002.review:
A really, [i]really[/i] bizarre point & click/puzzle/adventure/horror game. I'd want to give it a mixed rating - the theme and atmosphere are really cool, but as a puzzle game it's way too impenetrable.

[h1]The good:[/h1]
+ Creepy atmosphere
+ Nice visuals & sounds

[h1]The bad:[/h1]
- The puzzles are extremely opaque. I had to use the official walkthrough for parts of every single room. It's not that they are necessarily difficult puzzles, but it's often really hard to figure out what the game expects you to do to proceed. Your actions often have bizarre results, and you frequently have to repeat an action that at one random point gives a different result than at the previous repetitions.
- There is a secret correct order to do the rooms at, which is the only way to get 3 stars for all dinners (and it's not the order the game implies by the room numbers).
- Additionally to the previous one, some of the secret ingredients require completely unintuitive steps done at exactly the right occasion to acquire. And if you acquire them after you've already finished the room they belong to, too bad, you missed the opportunity to use them.

To sum it up, while it has an uniquely creepy atmosphere, the game does a [b]really[/b] bad job of communicating with the player.

35420442.review:
The macabre has ironically been beaten to death in the gaming world, what with blood and viscera having become a more common room decor than wallpaper. That makes it all the more refreshing when a game takes a more cerebral approach to murder, such as with a sophisticated murder mystery. If you’ve come to Rusty Lake Hotel looking for that, however, you’re not going to get much more than the appearance of sophistication. There are hints of something special here, but it’s obfuscated by a thin plot, awkward puzzles, and literal boar shit.

You are introduced to the proprietor of the Rusty Lake Hotel, one Mr. Owl, as he guides a raft of five guests across the quiet waters to their lodgings. Each of the animal-faced visitors has their own reason for attending Mr. Owl’s gathering, and it’s your job to attend to their needs during their stay. Every evening the guests will set down to dinner, and then afterwards you will follow one of them to their room to assist them in some way. There is an ulterior motive to your service, of course, and it will see more and more vacancies open at the hotel as you progress.

Spoiler alert for the main plot which you will learn about maybe five minutes into the game: The hotel has no main dishes to serve the guests, and said guests happen to be comprised of delicious meats. Whatever you may have been imagining about mysteries and intrigue, you can dump it because what you are actually doing here is murdering guests to feed to other guests. Most of the game takes place in the five rooms of the visitors, where a complex series of puzzles and brain-teasers will allow you to engineer a fatal encounter with the occupant and harvest their flesh. The next day you serve it to whoever remains, and then roll on to the next unlucky critter.

That makes the meat (heh) of the game the puzzles, and this is where most people are going to stumble. Each room is four walls covered with shelves, portraits, tables, and other decor that will be clicked upon and used to eventually kill someone. Expect plenty of locked cabinets with hidden keys, letter and number substitution puzzles, classics like unlabeled weights and measuring water out, and using strange items on other items. About half the puzzles are pretty logical and easy to spot but the other half is the killer, requiring you to click on sprouts until they randomly blossom into keys, or click on toy monkeys in a specific order, or look out a window at the right time, or feed a boar shit sandwich to the boar who shat it out. And let me assure you, I do not possess the capacity to make that last one up.

Mr. Boar’s room was where I almost gave up on the game, between the fecal snack and the bleeding toilet and the insipid, confusing puzzle-locked cabinets. I stuck with it to see where the game went and I’m happy to report that the ending is interesting, even if the means of getting there were not. Rusty Lake Hotel feels like an excerpt or aside from a much longer tale, one that needs context that isn’t given anywhere. Things happens because they HAVE to happen to advance the plot, not because they make sense. There’s a dark aura to the proceedings but the ridiculous elements like animal heads and poop take the Lynchian edge off and make it all feel awkward and arbitrary.

This one rides the line between yea and nay moreso than any other game I’ve reviewed thus far. It’s mechanically thin, the puzzles are poorly designed, and what little story there is is tainted by absurdity. But once you understand what it expects of you and what it offers it becomes a much smoother ride, and honestly the ending was a very bright point of darkness that helped color the game in retrospect. It’s hard to recommend but I don’t regret playing it in the end, and I must admit I’m interested in seeing what the rest of the series can offer.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish]curation page[/url]!

    "Встречайте наших гостей в «Отеле Расти-Лейк» и убедитесь, что их досуг будет незабываем. На этой неделе у нас пять обедов. Удостоверьтесь, что каждый обед достоин того, чтобы за него умереть"
Вы дворецкий,который должен убивать Ваших потояльцев,чтобы на утро из него приготовили обед... Несмотря на то,что это животные,все они антропоморфны и естественно наделены всеми человеческими качествами. 34238216.review:
Played Rusty Lake Roots and very much enjoyed it.   Had similar hopes for Rusty Lakes Hotel but was to be sadly disappointed.

It has the same quirky artwork and surreal (macarbre) settings which is fine but the game suffers from a HUGE problem

That is, you can not SAVE the game and it's own AUTOSAVE funstion is totally f***ed up.

To explain . . .

Your task is to collect the cooking ingredients for a variety of meals (3 ingredients each)
There are essentially 2 location areas.  There's the downstairs lobby and the upstairs rooms.
For some of the menus, the ingredients you need are both in the lobby and in the bedrooms.

The way the game works is that once you enter a bedroom, it locks the door and YOU CAN NOT LEAVE THE ROOM until you have collected the "meat" element of the recipe for that room.  This is an immediate problem.  If you didn't realise that one of the ingredients was downstairs and you've entered the bedroom there is no NO WAY to complete the full recipe (for which you gain 3 stars).   It's insane.  You even get to go back downstairs after you leave the bedroom but the item you wanted can not then be acquired.

There's a similar problem with the order in which things MUST be done if you want to achieve the full list of 3 ingredients for each recipe.   For example in one room, you get a knife and you use it help you get into a box.  However it is also used to rip open a picture on the wall.  Guess what, if you open the box first then the knife stays there and can't be picked up again.  Result you can't complete the recipe.  WTF?!   There is literally no clue about this unspoken order that is required, you thus are forced to keep redoing the "level" (bedroom) until you get it right.  There is however a HUGE BUT . . . .

When you go to reload from the autosave it puts you back into the bedroom before you touched anything which seems great until you realise that your inventory is MISSING THE INGREDIENT  that you previously first picked up in the lobby !!!   So once again you now can not complete the full recipe to gain your 3 stars.   At this point you are totally stuffed.  Your only choice now is to restart the entire ****ing game !

Sorry but this is simply ridiculous.

Any player is going to want to at least be able to complete the game and do it properly to earn all the stars.   However it simply isn't possible due to that broken autosave problem.  

After 3 bedrooms I had to abandon this.   I could put up with reloading specific bedrooms, if that actually worked, but having to restart the entire bloody game over and over to get a perfect score is just ludicrous.

A shame as Roots was a lovely game.  This is unplayable imo.

33513038.review:
My rule of thumb is that all games with effort into them are worth some amount of money. With that said, I still wish I hadn't bought the bundle this game came with. The story is minimal, but still interesting. Although, it's also never actually explained. Some will say "but you'll understand if you play the Cube Escape games!" but I say "Then it should be bundled with those game". Even then, any kind of side-game should still be even somewhat entertaining and understandable to some degree on its own. This game, isn't.

The puzzles range from actual brain-teasing to 100% random, to click-everywhere-until-something-happens-maybe. I enjoyed the puzzles that used legitimate logic, but some were either random and you had to find by accident, or completely betrayed the game's earlier use of logic. I won't spoil any of them, but by the time the end of the game came, the lack of closure or an actual story at all had me extra frustrated with the poor excuses for "puzzles" near the end of the game.

It's definitely easier, shorter, and more lacking in story than the other game in the bundle, Rusty Lake: Roots. But I personally regret purchasing both games. If you can get it for a dollar, buy it. If not, you can get the exact same experience watching someone play through it live.

这部游戏让我感觉很难受。锈湖系列的后作品比它好了太多。
优点：Mr. owl配音很棒。
缺点：有配音的段落少得可怜。
游戏操作感很差，只能用鼠标点来点去，有的时候乱点都能过关。
很多谜题只是简单地把答案放在了另一个地方，解谜的过程就是跑来跑去截图，毫无难度可言，甚至有很强的重复感。
最重要也是个人认为这款游戏最大的不足是：作为一部恐怖风格的作品，它的恐怖毫无格调可言。没有逻辑，没有线索，没有克苏鲁式的一步步推进的困惑氛围，有的只是突兀而画工拙劣的血腥场面。这样的恐怖毫无品味可言，就像三流恐怖片滥用番茄酱一样，只能让人看着烦。
直接去玩锈湖根源吧，别买捆绑包。

This game is disgusting. The only good thing is that the voice actor is charming, but only a tiny portion of the game is voiced.
The gameplay is horrible; you just move your mouse around and click click click. Randomly clicking counts.
The puzzles are no puzzle at all: they just put the answers elsewhere and to solve them you just need to run around and take notes/screemshots. Some puzzles are similar to another.
But the most important thing (and the main reason I dislike the game) is: as a horror styled game, the horror part is ... let's say cheap. No puzzle, no clue, no atmosphere(no stories at all), just pumping out something bloody and scary and what? That's horror? That's just disturbing or bothersome.
Just buy Rusty Lake Roots if you like the series. The bundle isn't worth it.

33377741.review:
This was my very first Rusty Lake game, which was...not a good idea. I'm glad I continued playing this series, but this isn't the best entry in it.

Pros:
- I loved the artwork and the voice actor for Mr. Owl.
- Wonderfully weird atmosphere.

Cons:
- Characters' non-reactions to things they should have reacted to. You can add poison to a character's drink right in front of him, and he'll still drink it. You can cut him and he won't even try to leave the room. And the sandwiches! You'd think he'd have stopped eating after the first bite!
- It's way too easy to move on in the game without having done everything you needed to do in order to make the best possible meal.
- The puzzle design isn't always the best, leading to some puzzles being more annoying than difficult. One puzzle in particular seemed to come with no clues whatsoever - you either consulted a walkthrough (which is what I did) or you kept clicking until you eventually came up with the exact series of 10 clicks you needed in order to solve the puzzle. (Edit: Apparently there was a clue, it was just much more subtle than the clues for most of the other puzzles.)

I'd recommend this only if you've played Rusty Lake: Roots (which is amazing) or the free Cube Escape games and want to know more of the story.
33377741.developer_response: Hi Mella thanks for your review. Sorry to hear that Hotel wasn't the best entry for our work. Glad you enjoyed the rest though, but hope you can also put it a bit in perspective as we made 7 free Cube Escape games first. We made Roots almost 8 months later and was a way bigger project. The non reactions from characters is something is part of our style, Roots has this as well. Thanks for your feedback though :)

33297860.review:
[h1] What is this game? [/h1]
Rusty Lake Hotel is highly reminiscent of those old Flash "Escape the Room" games. You find yourself at hotel where all of the other guests are various animals. Your goal: murder each guest and serve them for that night's dinner. Crazy and weird theme, but interesting nonetheless. The game is simply a series of room puzzles, where you click around to find items, combine these items or use them in the environment, and solve occasional puzzles that eventually lead to the death of your chosen guest. These types of games often suffer from "moon logic", where players can get stuck due to illogical item combinations, but fortunately Rusty Lake Hotel is pretty straight forward.

[h1] You Should [b]Buy[/b] This Game If: [/h1]
[list][*]You like "escape room" (point-and-click) style games
[*]You're looking for a quick gameplay experience (~1-2 hours)
[*]You want a laid back gameplay experience
[*]You like games that are weird and mildly disturbing (in a good way)[/list]

[h1] You Should [b]Skip[/b] This Game If: [/h1]
[list][*]You are looking for action or fast-paced gameplay
[*]You want a long experience
[*]You want a game with difficult puzzles (the ones here shouldn't be much of a challenge)[/list]

[h1] My Personal Opinion (Recommendation Reflects This) [/h1]
I personally really enjoyed Rusty Lake Hotel. It's a humble game: simple and short, but engaging and with an appropriate pricetag. For people looking to scratch that "escape room" itch or just want to kick back with a weirdly disturbing game, this should be right up your alley.

Le uniche pecche sono il doppiaggio, non sempre ben riuscito, e il fatto che sia su una finestra in flash player. 
Per il resto, totalmente consigliato!

32918040.review:
My name is Ms Parrot.  Welcome to the Rusty Lake Hotel.  It is part of Cube Escape but it is just fine own.

There is a dream-like quality to this place so I promise you that it will be quite the memorable experience.  There will be blood but only a little.  Some scares too but there is no need to hurry.

Each day takes you to a different room.  It is up to you to decide where to go.  Once there, you look around the room and puzzle out how to give the guest what they asked for.  Some things are not as straight-forward as you would hope but there is a logic to everything.  It can be cruel at times but no worse than in the past and certainly not in the future.

Things here will make more sense if you have played Cube Escape.  There is even a little surprise for you in Birthday if you reach perfection here.  But as it stands it is both longer and shorter than many Cube Escape.  I am aware that some may be a bit disappointed by the brevity but there are presently nine other titles free of charge and Roots is considerably longer.  It is an unusual change of pace and you will be getting a rather interesting experience.  I highly recommend it.

32830502.review: This is an enjoyable game- quite a dark twist on the hidden object and puzzle game. It doesn't take too long to play through, mabe 3-6 hours, depending upon how much of a perfectionist you are. The one quirk that annoyed me was that you can't reset just one "room" if you miss  an ingredient. To get the perfect outcome for all recipes, I had to start over four times. That was a fast process because I had my notes and could speed thhrough the re-do rooms, but it would be much easier to reset just one level as you can in Rusty Lake Roots. Despite that one frustration, I am still 100% glad I bought it, and I enjoyed the game thoroughly.

32821895.review: If you love puzzle games, try this.

32820562.review: This is an escape room. Plain and simple. A computerized game version of an escape room. It seems like an adventure game and the mechanics match point and click adventures for sure. But it shuts you up in several rooms and you can't get out until you reach the room's goal. It's very creepy actually, telling an Agatha Christielike parlor room mystery of sorts. All the ladies and gentry are there. But all played by anthropomorphic animals. It all kinda works. And that makes it more odd. More creepy. And being animation they can crank up the weirdness a bit. Not the negatives....I guess flash is okay, but note it will give you warning messages telling you it is affecting your computer until you let it. Not SUCH a terrible thing I suppose. It does save its checkpoints. The only really frustrating thing I've hit in the gameplay is...well sometimes you don't know just what you are supposed to click. WHich makes you just click random places everywhere. Which is kinf od a fault with the adventure genre to begin with. No different here, especially when some of the puzzles aren't really puzzles but more "you can't move forward in the story and get THIS object until you talk to that person across the room", which has no logic whatsoever. Still...this is insanely cheap...and I'm glad I found it. Most games for 99 cents are total garbage. I think there is a series of these Rusty Lake games. THis is the first one I played. The second I don't like as well. It doesn't have animals and weird murders. In fact the murder mystery aspect is exactly what sells this game as an escape room. Even though there's no time limit you feel the urgency and the story. The other just plods along waiting for you to do things with no real link. This has a narrative. The rabbit magician coming out of his own magic hat is my favorite.

32818157.review: A creepy and eerie game. It is so sinister but it draws you in and compels you to complete the game. If you have ever played escape the room games then this is going to scatch that itch. It really helps to play some of the free games by Rusty Lake online to get the background story behind these characters but it is not necessary. Overal a wonderful game.

[h1]괴기한 분위기의 포인트&클릭 어드벤쳐[/h1]

굉장히 독특한 분위기의 포인트&클릭 어드벤쳐 게임으로 
동물 머리를 한 반인반수의 모습의 기괴한 모습의 등장인물과
점점 호러스럽게 흘러가는 이야기의 흐름과 퍼즐의 컨셉들은
어딘지 모르게 엽기적인 분위기마저 느껴집니다.

호텔이 테마인 만큼 방을 기준으로 퍼즐이 나누어지는데
방마다 각각 개성있는 컨셉의 퍼즐들을 만들어 놨으며
퍼즐 난이도도 적당하여 그리 어렵지 않게 클리어할 수 있습니다.

게임 자체는 굉장히 매력있고 재미 있었지만
한가지 아쉬운 점은 이 게임이 독립적으로 완성되어 있다기보다는
개발사의 전작 시리즈와 세계관을 공유하고 있어서
이 게임만 플레이 했을 경우 뜬금포 엔딩에 읭? 하게 됩니다.

이 게임을 계기로 전작 시리즈에 빠지게 된 분들도 많은 것 같지만
모바일로만 나온 전작들을 굳이 해봐야 100% 즐길 수 있다는 점은
PC 게임 유저로서는 상당한 불만이었습니다.

요즘 같은 세상에 스마트폰이 없어서
전작을 할 수가 없다라는 사람은 없겠지만은
그래도 PC로 게임 하는 것을 더 선호하는 사람으로서
같이 묶어서 출시 해줬으면 더 좋지 않았을까 하는 아쉬움이 있네요

덧, 한글 지원은 안 하지만 문장들이 대체로 짧고 그 양도 적어서
간단한 수준의 문장만 해석이 되도 플레이 하시는 데는
큰 지장이 없을 것입니다.

I really don't understand the good reviews on this one. I am a huge fan of point and click/puzzle games. I love clever clues and connecting obscure bits of information to solve problems. While the premise (and trailer) set up what seems to be an intriguing plot and potentially interesting characters, don't expect any type of story or mystery here. You're the bad guy. You kill each person off and don't get a choice as to the order in which you do things, nor any freedom in HOW you remove each guest from the list. There is also no explanation for WHY these guests need to die, and when you are successful, it is uninteresting and ultimately unsatisfying.. Worst of all, you can only progress by clicking everything randomly and hoping something will happen, so there is no real reward for solving the "puzzles". 

No atmosphere, no interaction with guests (they all stand around silently...), no heart, no charm. In short, no immersion.

I was very disappointed. Not worth the $2..

32069630.review:
Reccomended with Reservations, as explained below:

Basically this is a flash game. An actual, runs in Shockwave flash game like your papi used to play when he was goofing off  in computer lab in high school. That sets a lot of limitations for how sophisticated the game can be, but to it's credit there's a great aesthetic on display that works well with the format. In normal mode anyway. 'Effects on' mode is a big step down.

If you like amatuer games, room escapes and just plain batshit crazy stuff there's a lot to like here. But there's two GIGANTIC caveats here and if you can't get down with those, don't buy this game.

1) The moon logic on display here is absurd even by conventional moon logic standards. You got a guy to kill, and the game gives you a knife, but you're kidding yourself if you think you're just gonna insert Knife A into Victim B and call it a job well done. No, instead you have to use the knife SPECIFICALLY ON THE DUDE'S ANTLERS so you can get blood to make him a bloody mary because we're all about hospitality here at Rusty Lake. Then you poison the drink. Also I'm pretty sure a Bloody Mary doesn't have actual blood in it. And if it did who needs the poison at that point? Just kick back and let Hepatitis do it's dark work.

2) Because of the limitations of the format, there are a lot of places in this game where if you don't know exactly where to look for what, you will not be able to solve all the puzzles and achieve the best rank. If you know where everything is you can beat the game in about 30-40 minutes but if you're a perfectionist you're going to be spending a lot of time solving the same puzzles over and over again.

Хочешь узнать, как приготовить пригласить гостей на званный ужин, приготовленный из тех же самых гостей? Cпроси меня как! Это самая наркоманская, приятно нарисованнная головоломка в которую я играла. У нас пять гостей, пять ночей, пять ужинов. Нужно убить каждого гостя и скормить его приготовленного в вине и с пряностями следующим жертвам. Но сделать это не так уж просто. This was an experience well worth the price tag and more. I'd love to see Rusty Lake Hotel continue on as a series, and I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys puzzles in a dark/surreal atmosphere.

I like how there are optional elements to the game, so that you can continue with the story and return to the "side puzzles" on a second playthrough for perfect score, and still enjoy the story and challenge. I personally did not find the majority of the puzzles too difficult, but enough so that they gave a sense of satisfaction upon completion. Even if there is contextually little reason for many of the puzzles, most have decent hints or logical solutions, aside from the optional items, which seem random most of the time. The surreal atmosphere of the game sort of made it work for me, at least with the main puzzles.

 I'm looking forward to seeing what the developers have in store!

Rusty Lake is a macabre point and click puzzle series. The games themselves have an interconnecting story, but they don’t have to be played in a specific order. The original Cube Escape games can be found online if you are interested in the larger story.

Rusty Lake Hotel is the shorter of the two, giving you a few puzzles to work through. While you can work through the puzzles in any order, you can unlock a secret that can be used in one of the online Cube Escape games if everything is done right. If you are unsure if you would like this game, I recommend playing the Cube Escape games to find out.

30228537.review:
[i]Cette review a été co-écrite avec Parallel Platypus dont l’expertise en mathématiques a bien été utile lors de la résolution des énigmes du jeu.

S’inspirant de la série Twin Peaks, Rusty Lake est autant le nom du studio néerlandais que de l'endroit mystérieux dans lequel leurs jeux prennent vie. Le genre « escape the room » qui demande de s'échapper d'une pièce en résolvant une succession de puzzles est devenu leur spécialité avec d'abord des jeux disponibles sur mobiles et navigateurs nommés les Cube Escape, surréalistes et offrant des ambiances sordides et fascinantes. Puis, par la suite, les développeurs voient plus grand et proposent un jeu complet sur Steam, aujourd'hui déjà rejoint par une suite « Rusty Lake Roots ».[/i]

Quand on vous dit que le jeu s'inspire de Twin Peaks c'est pour son pitch surréaliste et glauque. Les personnages, semblables à des humains à tête d'animaux, se réunissent dans un hôtel sur invitation d'un être mystérieux, Mr Owl. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=873799459 L'histoire ne tarde pas à virer au huis clos morbide, dans la lignée des Dix petits nègres d'Agatha Christie.

Parent de nombreux représentants flash disponibles gratuitement un peu partout sur le web, le gameplay de type « escape game » est très simple à comprendre : on a affaire à un point & click dont le principe est de s’échapper d’une pièce en résolvant des énigmes d’apparence simples mais dont les clés de la résolution sont dissimulées dans les autres écrans (les escape games se déroulant usuellement à la première personne, il n’y a pas de protagoniste à déplacer). Il n’y a pas forcément de liens logiques entre actions et conséquences : en aidant par exemple notre hôte, on sera récompensé par un objet tout à fait improbable mais qui d’un coup, apparaît comme l’élément-clé d’un étrange puzzle (fantastique oblige !). Pourtant la logique n’est pas partie aux oubliettes puisque les petites énigmes sollicitent bien souvent nos connexions synaptiques dans la partie « logique et déduction » de notre cerveau : (énigmes basées sur des équations à deux inconnues, séquence à retrouver en faisant preuve d'observation ou encore puzzles stratégiques demandant au joueur de faire preuve d'anticipation). http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=873799600 On alterne donc entre énigmes classiques et originales, certaines reposant d'avantage sur la logique mathématique et d'autres sur l'observation et la déduction.

Les dessins réalisés pour le jeu Rusty Lake Hotel ont une ligne claire et un style sobre à base de grands aplats de couleurs. On peut dire que dans un puzzle-game la lisibilité des scènes est primordiale. On va en effet être amené à inspecter chaque recoin des pièces dans lesquelles on se trouvera, à la recherche du moindre indice qui pourra débloquer la situation. A côté de ça règne cette ambiance noire, presque en décalage avec le style visuel choisi mais qui au final fonctionne très bien dans le sens où l'atmosphère étrange du jeu n'en est que renforcée. 

Dans le fond, Rusty Lake Hotel ne propose rien de nouveau mais ce qu'il propose est intelligent, bien pensé et réalisé avec soin. Pour les sceptiques allez faire un tour sur le site du studio pour vous essayer à des jeux flash gratuits reprenant l'univers du jeu. Pour ceux qui sont convaincus, il ne reste qu'à débourser la modique somme de 1,99 € pour vous offrir ce petit (mais non moins réussi) jeu d'énigmes.

[quote]Lisez d'autres avis sur ma page de curation : [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9002662/]Kitsune's Guide[/url][/b][/quote]

30203342.review:
Embark on a macabre puzzle adventure where your guests are the main course at The Rusty Lake Hotel. Each night you must corner a guest and gather up ingredients including the flesh of the guest themselves via a room-escape style puzzle system where solving one section unlocks progression towards another puzzle. There’s also a challenge system that ultimately requires finding the right order in which to “serve” your guests with the optimum ingredients that are only available at certain points in the game.

Rusty Lake hotel holds up quite well for a flash game and the puzzles are actually challenging enough to make you stop and think, something absent from a lot of point and click games these days. I do wish it as a bit longer but it’s still a steal for such a low price.

I love this game and all others in the series. I purchased this, Roots, and have all the free ones on my phone. The gameplay is great, the puzzles are just challenging enough, and I am never bored. The dark themes and underlying implications resonate in the player's head for hours, even days after playing the game, and you just constantly hunger for more (no joke intended ;] ). The developers are incredibly friendly, and even with their fanbase growing at an exponential rate they are constantly in contact via email or twitter or what have you. The soundtrack, too, is phenomenal, and the art. The effort that went into this game is clear as day, and I HIGHLY recommend it. 

The one and only thing I would complain about, and this is only for the MOBILE version: If you are an impatient person (me) playing the game for the 11th time (me) and you get a little excited with clicking things (...me...), then it is somewhat easy to "break" the game. However, it does have a VERY good memory and will put you back only to the start of your level once restarted. I downloaded it from steam and played the first level (again) and found that it is actually a lot cleaner, and had very few glitches.

TL;DR- 100% worth your time/money, don't be impatient

29565260.review:
Cube Escape 시리즈의 최초 유료 작품입니다. 그리고 그 사실을 기쁘게 생각합니다:)
틀에 박힌 방탈출 게임들을 플레이하며 지루함을 느끼셨다면 추천드리는 게임입니다. 목표는 탈출이 아니지만 포맷은 방탈출 류의 그것을 따르고 있습니다.

-스타일:
게임의 목적은, 시작하자마자 나오지만 다섯 명의 동물 손님들을 하루에 한 명씩 잡아 저녁상에 올리는 것입니다. 잔인한 내용이지만 고어하거나 유혈낭자한 묘사는 나오지 않습니다. 피도 조금 흐르는 정도고요. 묘한 동화풍의 그래픽과 연출이 어우러져 잔혹동화 같은 느낌을 줍니다. 공포라기도 민망한 정도이니 겁내지 않으셔도 됩니다.

-그래픽:
특유의 그림체가 매력적입니다. 움직임이나 오브젝트의 변화 등이 딱딱하지 않게 잘 되어있습니다.

-게임성:
아이템이나 힌트의 배치가 적절합니다. 너무 쉽지도, 어렵지도 않은 적당한 난도라고 생각합니다. 다만 별 세 개를 위해 얻어야 하는 선택 재료가 조금 졸렬하게(…) 감추어져 있는 경우가 있습니다. 공략을 보면 찾기 힘들 정도로요. 하지만 이 경우는 사실상 한 번 뿐입니다. 개연성이 떨어지는 상호작용/조사 또한 아주 없다고는 단언할 수는 없지만 마찬가지로 경우는 적습니다. 꼼꼼히 관찰하신다면 무난히 깰 수 있습니다. 저는 공략의 힘을 빌렸지만^^; 이렇게 적으니 설득력이 없는데 정말로 괜찮습니다. 막히신다 해도 게임 내의 옵션에 walkthrough를 볼 수 있는 선택지가 있고, 공략을 정리해놓은 팬 사이트도 있으니 엔딩을 보는 데에 장해는 없을 듯합니다:)

Rusty Lake Hotel은 이 게임 자체로도 재미있지만, 시리즈인 전작들을 먼저 플레이하신 후 즐긴다면 더욱 볼 거리와 파고들며 느낄 수 있는 재미가 많은 게임입니다. 모바일로도 있고, Cube Escape로 웹에 검색하시면 금방 나오기 때문에 같이 즐기시는 걸 추천드립니다.

좋아하는 게임이에요. Roots에 이어 어서 다음 작품이 나오길 기다리고 있습니다!

29415445.review:
[h1]A nice, unique environment for a point-n-click puzzler, but, ultimately was just kind of....odd, but still interesting.[/h1]

I really liked the atmosphere and the art style, and the unique (to me) macabre, dark puzzle setting.  It made for fresh experience for a puzzle game.

On the downside though, some of the puzzles seemed just a little [i]odd[/i] maybe?  Most puzzles I think made sense, but some puzzles were difficult to know what you were even supposed to do, which led me to wandering around and just clicking on everything and then seeing something happen which was also sometimes equally inexplicable to me.  While I did resort to a walkthru for one puzzle, the puzzle itself made sense -- I just couldn't figure that one out.  That's on me. :-P   But what I did find kind of telling is that the game's own menu system has links to walkthroughs for each of the rooms.  I'm not sure if I should see this as a convenience for the player, or an admittance that even the devs think some of the puzzles just don't make sense?

[h1]Overall:  I enjoyed my time in the game and I want to like it more than I ultimately did, and also considering that the game is quite short (it still only took me 2.5hrs but I'm sure that's longer than avg), I'd rate this ~ a 6.5 out of 10.[/h1]

29397927.review: It's an odd game and very macabre. Some of it made me feel a bit ill to be honest, even though it's all cartoony flash graphics. You enter a room with a certain guest, solve a series of puzzles that give you keys or clues to the next one - eventually you kill the guest to feed the others and then move on to the next room. I think the game will stick with me because of the things you have to do more than anything else, the story itself and the characters are not well fleshed out and I wasn't that interested   in what was actually going on by the end. If it's cheap and you like puzzles then there are worse games to buy, but I couldn't recommend it any higher than that.

29286175.review:
玩过《锈湖：根源》之后，再回头玩《锈湖旅馆》，难度相对而言大大降低，因为《旅馆》的逻辑性更符合常理

但是，如果想要达成完美通关，一周目不看攻略是不太可能的，因为[spoiler]有一个杀人顺序先后的问题[/spoiler]

其实，本质上这就是一个[spoiler]阿加莎·克里斯蒂式的《无人生还》，一群人应邀到旅馆，然后被逐个屠宰，成为彼此口中的盘中餐

唯一不同的是，这种屠杀的目的不是出于“复仇”，而是一种邪教性质的“生命延续”，也是为之后的《根源》做了剧情上的铺垫

有趣的是，每个角色都有象征意义，比如饕餮的猪先生，骄傲的鹿，自恋的孔雀，阴郁的蝙蝠

《根源》里面有一个谜题是用望远镜观看旅馆，从而在书架上第二排得知动物头像摆放顺序，可见《旅馆》剧情发生的时间，与James阅读书籍研究叔叔留下的日记时间一致，也就是说两个故事酝酿着同一个阴谋——不是William的重生，而是Mr.Owl下着一盘一种关于重生和生命延续炼金术的棋

即使在《根源》里复活的William也只是庞大棋盘中的一枚棋子——虽然故事的结局来看，他是幸存者、唯一的人生赢家，可是谁知道他的命运还掌握在Mr.Owl手中呢

游戏性★★★☆☆
故事性★★★★☆[/spoiler]

29193548.review: Totally worth the money, which in itself wasn't very much. It was a puzzle game what was totally possible and just the right amount of challenging. There were times I was stuck, but after taking a step back and observing everything, it was do-able. The thing that I love about it is that there's the main game (basic murder; no big deal!), PLUS optional items for you to find for every meal. I got through the game in about an hour but then spent a few more trying to get the perfect three stars for every meal. The only cons I would list are the dreary music (cool for atmosphere at first but if you were like me and played it enough to log more than 5 hours, it gets old and depressing), and the fact that if you messed up ONE TINY PART in your quest for a perfect score, you had to start over (every meal had an ingredient that was incredibly specific to find and only on certain night or certain ways). The good thing about this though like I said, was the fact that they're optional ingredients for a reason: you can still really enjoy the game without going the extra 5 miles.

目前没有打完，暂时给一个阶段性的评价，大约7/10。
首先，感觉设定很新奇，一群动物住旅馆，今天死一个明天死一个，大家居然还满不在乎的吃晚饭（而且晚饭和死者的肉还一样呢），也是相当朋克。

音乐音效方面中规中矩，感觉没有什么特别要讲的，感觉鸮先生声音比较磁性，乌鸦就十分的乌鸦。

28990146.review:
Macabro e delizioso (proprio il caso di dirlo), Hotel fa parte di una articolata serie di escape room, scorrevoli ma da non sottovalutare. Controllare ogni minimo dettaglio per risolvere le camere dei bizzarri ospiti e per vedere tutto quello che il gioco offre, occorrerà eseguire azioni nel modo giusto per sbloccare le zone opzionali (in pratica occorre cucinare con tutti gli ingredienti e per farlo le stanze andranno risolte in uno specifico ordine). Se grafica e score sono buoni, il lato ludico è appagato però manca un qualsiasi filo narrativo se preso come prodotto a se stante, lasciando spiazzati al termine. Ciò perchè fa parte di un setting ben più ampio, Rusty Lake appunto, in cui Hotel si incastra, composta da altri mini "scenari" di solito pubblicati su mobile, gratuiti e pure fruibili dal loro sito ufficiale. Omaggia moltissimo Twin Peaks, quindi surreale e onirico.
Effettivamente andrebbero giocati in ordine, troverete dettagli qui http://www.rustylake.com/about/
Messo così avrei promosso l'esperienza pur con qualche riserva ma sono incappato troppe volte in spiacevoli reset dei progressi dovendo ricominciare daccapo, colpa probabilmente di qualche incompatibilità con ciò che a conti fatti è un gioco in flash. Questo è inaccettabile. Refund.

28977131.review:
结局Mr.Owl说“方块不仅可以记忆过去，还可以穿越到未来。”
                      “人死了以后也会变成方块。”  
                      “这游戏的主观视角是Harvey的（女主养的鸟。”
不管这游戏画风多么可爱，剧情依旧玩的让我背后发凉。剧情里每个人的房间里都有一张邀请函，Mr.Owl说他有邀请他们来的理由，（大概是练成黑白方块，方块是消耗品，来补充维持平衡。是理想邪教为自己苟里（xuming）的黑暗事实。

你知道理想主义者最可恶的地方在哪里吗？他们把你带到山顶看到了光。然后你低下头，回忆起自己生活在肮脏的蛆虫之中。他们怀揣着自己的目的告诉你要有悲悯之心，你却只能看见野兽撕咬着自己身上的血肉，不知道该不该笑着说好。

并不知道自己在胡说什么（补一句无关游戏的话：我回头看见身后的你，感觉一切都有它存在的意义了。

28976717.review:
轻微血腥，几乎没有恐怖感觉，谜题本身逻辑性不是那么强，但是难度并不高，两小时左右不完美通关，想完美通关的话一周目不看攻略有点费劲，很多隐藏道具除非运气好否则你是想不到去哪拿的。剧情本身很迷，本作来说单纯是把来旅店的客人，满足其要求后艺术的杀死，但是以最终结局来看似乎很有隐喻性，据说是系列作，所以单玩这一作也看不懂了。主要是游戏很便宜，还算值得一玩。

	[spoiler]和女友一起玩一起烧脑其乐无穷，尤其你的女友是个机智的小公主的情况下	[/spoiler]

28937070.review:
I've really enjoyed playing this. 
The puzzles are tricky sometimes, but not too hard, after you think about the problem for a while.
A hint from my side -> Get yourself a pen and some paper, it might come in handy. (:

Afterall, i can recommend this game; all of the rusty lake games i have played before aswell.

The only downsides of these games - they fall a bit short, have no achievements and no trading cards. But it's still a neat collection that should be played.

28931362.review:
Je to skvělá point-and-click hra. Hraní se v jednotlivých fázích omezuje na 4 obrazovky, díky čemuž je hra skvěle přehledná a nestane se, že budete někde ztraceně pobíhat. Postupy ve hře jsou logické a dá se celkem jasně říct, co je další úkol, i když občas trochu trvá, než člověk pochopí, co se po něm chce (takže jsem potřebovala pár nápověd). 
Stylově mi to připomíná Submachine, která funguje na podobných principech. 
Je to relativně krátká hra, já jsem pomalá a byla jsem hotová za dvě hodiny. 
Co se grafiky týče, všechno je ostré, nesnaží se o nějaké realistické malůvky, které dělají hledání předmětů nemožné a taky to není žádné hledání pixelů. Hra, jak má být. 
Příběh mě poněkud mátl, respektive jsem nechtěla za začátku věřit tomu, co se to tam děje, je to celkem ulítlé.

28927119.review:
强烈推荐锈色湖系列的解密游戏，独特的游戏风格，略带恐怖的氛围，深刻的故事以及优秀而又不失有趣的解密，再加上便宜的价格（前几作应该都是免费的），无一不为这个系列增添风采
本作没记错的话是作为锈色湖系列的衍生作出现的，解密上虽然不够四季机制那么有趣，不过作为解密游戏仍然水准很高，美中不足就是太短了些

strongly recommended rusty lake series. With unique style, horror atmosphere, deep and profound storyline and distinguished puzzle-solving, it really outstand much of its kind.
This game is not related to the series directly but shares the same background so familiar characters will appear and the whole atmosphere for the game is consistant with the whole series. The puzzle-solving itself, not as interesting as seasons though, is high leveled as well. If you have to point out some negative points to this game, it'll be its game length. It's too short.

28850464.review:
If your sense of humor is on the twisted side, you'll love this game's puzzles!

The game is short, but hillariously macabre.  The goal is to kill all the animal-guests coming to dinner so you can serve them  to the other animal-guests.  You'll find ways to electrocute them in their bathtub, poison their bloody marys, and booby trap their furniture. If that idea makes you chuckle, you'll love the game. Durant les soldes Steam, ce jeu à 99 centimes ne vous laissera pas indifférent si vous aimez les "pointez-Cliquez"

28736894.review: Excellent point-and-click game, especially for its price. Love the surreal music and atmosphere, as well as the art style. Highly recommended for people who like this genre!

28730815.review: Fantastic little puzzle game with lots of dark humour. Puzzles aren't too difficult but the completionist in me has to playthrough a couple of times to make sure I got every item available. A great way to spend a free evening, and the sequel is even better and MUCH weirder.

28729902.review:
Я всегда был далек от квестов, как то они обходили меня стороной, да я и не стремился к ним, а если когда либо натыкался, быстро выключал и шел играть во что то по экшовей, потому что они мне казались уж больно скучными во всех планах. Но вот я захотел приобрести игру Rusty Lake Roots, почитав положительные комментарии, решил что надобно бы ознакомиться, ведь тут попахивает сюром, а это интересно. Сразу выяснилось, что это не первая игра серии, есть еще Rusty Lake Hotel (а еще и куча квестов на сайте разработчика, как выяснилось позже). Так я потратил 70 руб. на обе игры, купив их по распродаже, что в общем не дорого. Но все же первое впечатление "омг я купил флеш игру=\"; и сразу вспомнил мультфильмы про масаню в далеком 2004. Но как оказалось довольно интересную и необычную флеш игру. Сюжет как таковой прост, и можно сказать скуп (но я знал что это не одна игра серии, так что и не расчитывал, что он раскроется до конца, если как таковой имеется, конечно): постояльцы заселились в отель на озере, и куда-то, внезапно, стали пропадать. Так чем же все таки интересен именно данный квест? Ведь, по сути они все одинаковы: кликай, ищи предметы, решай головоломки, ну и продвигайся по сюжету, если авторы вас озадачат всякими записками и тд. Здесь не озадачили, есть четкие цели, коих немного, иди делай. И я уверен, что такого вы в других квестах не видели, я говорю про сеттинг, ведь Rusty Lake Hotel и берет своей атмосферой, своей подачей он и выделяется на фоне остальных игр данного жанра. В первой комнате я почти сразу воспользовался прохождением, потому что я даже догадаться бы не смог, что мне такое нужно сделать, и первый вердикт был: ШИЗА! Но эту шизу я осилил по сути в один присест (не последнюю роль тут сыграли интересные головоломки), и как прошел, не долго размышлял, чтоб сесть за вторую часть)))

 Я рекомендую игру любителям сюрреализма, чего то необычного и тд. Игра проходится довольно быстро, так что ничего страшного даже если вы не любитель квестов (как я).

 Пара рекомендаций: не переживайте, что игра не на русском, а русификатора нет не только в руководствах стим, но и в сети, для прохождения достаточно базового английского, текста тут не много. А если использовать гугл переводчик, то подойет вообще всем. Потом, я бы порекомендовал сразу посмотреть в советах поочередность прохождения комнат, дабы сразу пройти на 100% и голова не было. Если на первые комнаты три это будет понятно и так, то на последние две, догадаться уж совсем трудно.

28325215.review:
Cube Escape系列的一个OVA，故事在19世纪末，讲述锈湖，黑色盒子，记忆，还有通向未来之路这些来源。这一有很多内容，甚至还有情节中的收集要素。我就是因为玩了两关后意识到玩的顺序不对而导致收集不齐食材又重新开了一遍，大约4小时不到就能通关，当然我也算是个对解谜游戏不是很拿手的玩家，所以花的时间也挺长的。

游戏制作很用心，绝对值这个价格。音效，视觉效果完全承接手游，并且在电脑上能体现出很精致的效果。
非常推荐，当然更加推荐给玩过手机上CubeEscape系列的玩家，不要犹豫了，直接买steam版吧，顺便。喜加一，还有卡牌，比ios的更有意义，而且大陆的游戏还便宜。

28319366.review:
Totally positive experience.
I had a trouble with a bug during the cup trick (the rabbit's room), but after that everything has been ok.
It's a oniric game where you have to kill guests with always different theme and solutions.
It worth its cost, I'm satisfied and I'm going to buy Rusty lake roots too.

28253717.review:
[b]Rusty Lake Hotel[/b] is a point-and-click puzzle game in which the events take a morbid turn fast, these events being the consequence of the player's actions.

 The game looks like your average [i]room escape[/i] game until your realize what your solved puzzles are about to do, this weird, dark atmosphere being what makes the game unique. The puzzles aren't too hard to solve but can be a bit challenging if you want to get three stars every night.

 The artstyle is simple yet beautiful, animations are kept to a minimum and the sounds are the kind you would hear in browser-based flash games. The story is minimal and has a few references to the overall story of [i]Rusty Lake[/i]. The game's eerie atmosphere, low price, and quality of the puzzles are what make it worth playing. 9/10

28246944.review: Atmospheric, engaging, puzzles are fun. Loved this.

28239133.review: Nice game. Decent puzzles. Nothing too fancy. Can be wrapped up in 2 hours. Lovely music. But...the ending is a definite problem. I would have been content without the end conversation honestly. The puzzles themselves can be solved without hit and trial - which is the whole point of the game. Definitely macabre setting.

28210579.review: I have to say, this game was pretty freaking awesome. I love the artstyle, and even though it was pretty predictable WHAT you were serving at dinner each night, it was fun to see how it all goes down. The puzzles, to me, were well done. They were hard, but not "bash your head against a desk" hard. Would benefit a bit for some achievements, like one for completing each room and maybe one for getting all stars on all the dinners. For only $2, it's a pretty awesome game. Can't wait to play Roots :)

28113809.review:
Eerie indeed.
Initially thought what could a flash game bring new to my world. Was completely wrong!

27950267.review:
Vous êtes engagé par Mr Owl pour vous occuper des invités de son hôtel. Votre principal mission sera de préparer le diner. Petite subtilité : ce sont les invités qui sont au menu. Il faudra leur rendre visite dans leur chambre pour trouver le moyen de vous débarasser d'eux.

C'est un jeu surprenant. Une succession d'escape room avec chacune leur propre thème. Les énigmes en elle même ne sont pas spécialement difficiles. Certains éléments peuvent être loupés si on ne sait pas ou ils se trouvent. 

On sent qu'il y'a un univers très interessant derrière, ce qui me donne envie de suivre les autres productions de ce studio.

27894022.review: The riddles are quite easy and the game itself doesn't last more than one hour, one and a half. However, it's pretty entertaining (and cheap), so, what else do you need?

I have a hard time recommending it for anyone other than total fans of point and click escape room puzzlers because there are free flash games exactly like this online. It's a pretty fun little adventure, though, so what the heck. For 2 bucks, go for it

27716154.review: Reminds me of some of those really trippy, surreal for-adults cartoons that seriously weirded me out as a little kid back in the 70s (yes, I'm old). Short and ending is rather open-ended, but nice artwork, interesting puzzles and intriguing story.  Very nice from the price.

27686366.review: This game is pretty crazy. Everything is not as it seems, but moreso, not as it feels. Hop in and get your mind twisted.

27669092.review: pokud jste hráli nějakou nebo dokonce všechny Cube Escape hry od Rusty Lake a bavila vás, zaujala příběhem či zpracováním tak nic neztratíte, když si tuhle hru koupíte

27648712.review: I am sorry. Your place is already taken.

27578206.review:
Крайне атмосферная и мило нарисованная головоломка от создателей квестов Cube Escape. Собственно, к играм этой серии есть довольно много очевидных и не совсем отсылок на протяжении сюжета Hotel.
Уровень загадок иногда немного абсурдный, как, к примеру, с тремя статуэтками обезьянок в комнате Мистера Кабана.
Но шесть постояльцев, повар, лифтёр и загадочный хозяин продуманы в своих характерах весьма ярко, поэтому игра больше о погружении в эту немного сюрреалистичную местами атмосферу, а не о бесконечном решении загадок, на которых и строится львиная часть геймплея.
Рецепты блюд вызывают небольшую зависть к тем, кто их отведает, и мрачную усмешку: ведь именно мы поставяляли необходимые ингридиенты для дорогих гостей.
Вкратце: красиво рассказанная причудливая история в милой атмосфере Отеля на озере.
[i]"The past is never dead it's not even past"[i]

27534695.review: Одна из лучших игр, в своем жанре. Коротковата, но есть же еще куча бесплатных предысторий, плюс продолжения всё выходят. Однозначно стоит играть.

27424319.review:
Short and sweet (1 hour to 1.5 hours) and very surreal puzzle game where you not only have to think outside the box...but also have to pretty much discount any common sense on the guests' part.

Also remember to NOT immediately go to the chef after the end of each night. Explore the screens a bit before you do that to get all the ingredients you need.

Though, you don't need 100% Stars completion unless you are also playing one the Rusty Lake: Birthday installment, because that's where the code you get is used.

Also remember the order of the stamps!

27394355.review:

Rusty Lake Hotel è una piccola perla, una breve avventura grafica ben confezionata con un'atmosfera delirante resa sia dalle ambientazioni e dai personaggi ma soprattutto dalle situazioni assurde in cui ci troveremo.
Gli enigmi sono piuttosto bilanciati, non troppo difficili ma nemmeno troppo facili, i livelli passano piacevolmente senza blocchi mentre la storia è molto ben congenata, l'idea di fondo è molto interessante e in un certo modo malata e grottesca, personalmente l'ho molto apprezzata. 
A livello tecnico: la graficha è semplice ma accattivante, i disegni sembrano venir fuori da un libro di Beatrix Potter sotto acidi; per quanto riguarda l'audio invece senza infamia e senza lode, forse si poteva fare qualcosina in più ma è comunque più che sufficiente.

Complessivamente lo consiglio senza esitazione, compratelo non ve ne pentirete.

26592534.review:
Rusty Lake Hotel

The Lake will be Grateful

Developer: Rusty Lake

Year:  2015

Genre: Horror, Puzzle, Point 'n' Click

Franchise: Rusty Lake/Cube Escape

Engine: IDK

TL;DR
Rusty Lake Hotel is an inexpensive, eerie point and click puzzler by the folks behind the excellent "Cube Escape" series, which can be found on Kongregate or through the devs at www.rustylake.com. For under 5 NZ dollars you can pick up this game and the sequel, both of which fit into the larger narrative that started in the aforementioned flash games. Score, Visuals and Puzzles mesh to make something truly special.

REVIEW

Story:
I've seldom seen storytelling done like this. Characters speak directly very infrequently and intuitive pictoral hints tell you a ton about the characters you meet. The story seems minimal, but everything that happens means something, even if you can't tell what it is. This game is ideal if you want to sit back and revel in the weirdness of some incredibly creative indie devs. Deeper story elements are shown, but they are murky and obscured, masterfully working with the continued theme of the lake. Dark gods, esoteric spirits and twisted motives lurk below the seemingly innocuous children's book style and mundane puzzle tasks. The story is a delight to unveil, so I will tell you no more. 8.5/10

Graphics:
The art style is... Unique. Imagine a blend between 'American Gothic', 'Over the Garden Wall', old silent cartoons and creepy taxidermies, and you begin to get an idea of the excellent visuals presented in this game. Click through the screenshots if you can't be bothered googling those things. Everything is unsettling and surreal, but subtly. It feels like a dusty piece of American folk art, which really clicks with my particular sensibilities. With that said, I can see how the limited animation and somewhat simple graphics could be a putoff. For me, it's a real hit. 9/10

Gameplay:
Aside from a few irritating or samey puzzles, Rusty Lake Hotel is a sterling example of puzzle gaming. The game sets seemingly mundane tasks with esoteric twists and disturbing results. I won't discuss the intent of the puzzles, but they follow a shared, sinister theme. While the weakest element of the game, the puzzles are still excellent. 7/10

Overall:
I opened my steam wallet and found it was bare,
I thought to myself that there was something there
Just a moment before, but I remembered with shame,
That it a fever I had spent it on games. 

I looked through my library for something new, 
Found Jotun, The Deed and Surgeon Sim too
But there were two more that caught my attention
To find out was it was about my intention 
I booted it up and soon saw my mistake
When I thought the worst of the game Rusty Lake.

The visuals, the music, the tension thick as tar, 
The mystery, the ambience, the puzzles bizarre
I soon bought the sequel, my thirst not yet slaked,
I'd become an addict of the studio Rusty Lake.

In short, RL:H is a game that I am proud to have in my Steam Library. It's Short but Satisfying, Unsettling but with no Jumpscares and Interesting without Exposition. 8.5/10

Til my next review!

26410324.review:
Rusty Lake的第一部收费作品，延续了cube escape系列的优秀素质。
共通的优点：
1.严谨的解谜流程设计。别看这系列里道具用法都有些另类甚至丧心病狂，但解谜的推进都很符合逻辑，玩家能够明确下一步应该干什么；所有道具，可互动设计，线索都没有任何多余，绝大部分都对推动解谜进程起一定作用（剩下的少部分为对故事背景或者世界观的补充），看似违和的地方必有玄机。
2.难度合适的谜题。不会让人望而却步毫无头绪，玩着玩着就只能跟攻略走；也不会太过无聊或者明显让人毫无成就感。
3.主次分明。寻物部分和小游戏的设计起到很好的点缀作用，不像有些解谜游戏小游戏难度太高，或者寻物太过困难繁琐，存在感远超游戏本身的解谜要素。
4.没有任何出戏的提示。谜题的提示都融入游戏背景中，小游戏也不会明显提示任何的玩法或目的，全靠玩家自己摸索，代入感很强。

本作的特点：
1.加入隐藏收集要素。这本来可以说是一个改进，但游戏却没有与之相应的存档或者分章节设置，错过了的道具就只能从头玩一遍来获取，很不方便；另外没有成就系统略遗憾。
2.点击两次获取道具。可能是防止乱点？然而这系列寻物本来就不是重点，我有好几次明明已经发现了道具，但习惯性只点了一次结果没有获取。再加上很多道具错过就没法收集的设定，这新设计感觉很坑爹。
3.风格有些改变。原系列的角色除了rusty lake的几个怪鸟外基本还都是人，本作全部变成动物了；没有惊吓桥段和一些超现实的灵异展开。总体来说感觉像是从惊悚悬疑故事变成了黑色童话。

总体而言，纵向比较，作为收费作品，本作比起之前的作品并没有什么明显的突破；但横向比较，本作仍然是一款出色的解谜游戏，史低5元的价格值得强力推荐。另一方面，多支持这部作品，也能鼓励Rusty Lake出更多更好的作品。

26409139.review:
Well, I came back to play this after playing the sequel, Rusty Lake: Roots. I was hoping for something really compelling. Did I find it? Well, no. I really wanted to like this game, and it did feel like you were actually solving puzzles more than it did in Roots. However, the superficial elements of the story were predictable, and the non-superficial elements, if they existed, were obfuscated to the point where you didn't really engage with or care about them. Also, the game's buggy. It's easily possible to put it in an unwinnable state by doing things in an order other than what the developers expected. Did I earn all the stars? Also no, but I in no way felt compelled to go back and try. Some cheap scatological humour put me off a bit as well. 

This wasn't a terrible game, and it was certainly odd, plus it's very inexpensive. However, it didn't deliver much of an experience, and I think you'd be fine just playing Roots and skipping this one.

สำหรับเกมราคา 49.- บาทที่ได้มาจากการลดราคาอีก 50% ในคืนวันฮัลโลวีน ต้องกล่าวว่า "Rusty Lake Hotel" ถือได้เป็นการลงทุนที่คุ้มเสียยิ่งกว่าคุ้ม เพราะมันคือหนึ่งในเกมแนว Point & Click ที่โดดเด่นและมีเอกลักษณ์เฉพาะมากที่สุดเกมหนึ่งที่ผมเคยเล่นมา และนี่ก็คืออีกหนึ่งเกมดีที่คุณอาจจะพลาดเผลอทำตกสำรวจไป

"Rusty Lake Hotel" เป็นเกมแนว Point & Click แนว Horror (ที่ไม่สู้จะหลอนสักเท่าใดนัก) ที่กล่าวถึงแขกผู้มาเยือนอันประกอบด้วยเหล่าสรรพสัตว์ที่นับรวมได้ 5 สายพันธุ์ที่เดินทางมาเข้าพักยัง Rusty Lake Hotel ด้วยจุดประสงค์อันต่างกัน แต่พวกเขาไม่ใช่ตัวเอกของเกมนี้แต่อย่างใด ทว่าพวกเขาคือเหยื่อของคุณผู้เป็นบริกรของโรงแรมกลางทะเลสาปอันลึกลับแห่งนี้ต่างหาก

เหมือนเช่นที่กล่าวไปเมื่อครู่ คุณจะได้รับบทเป็นบริกรผู้ได้รับสั่งจาก "คุณนกฮูก" ให้ไล่ล่าสังหารแขกผู้มาเยือนทั้งห้า หนึ่งคนต่อหนึ่งคืน เพื่อที่จะนำเนื้อของพวกเขามาเสริฟบนจานเป็นมื้อเช้า ถ้าเป็นเกมแอ็คชั่นทั่วไปก็คงไม่จำเป็นต้องเรื่องมาก แค่ถือมือเข้าไปจิ้มเหยื่อให้ตายดับก็คงจะจบ แต่ไม่ใช่ในเกมนี้ ในเมื่อตัวเกมเป็น Point & Click คุณจึงจำเป็นที่จะต้องใช้หัวคิดเพื่อที่จะสังหารเหยื่อผู้เคราะห์ร้ายเหล่านี้ ปริศนาของเกมออกจะแลดูเหนือจินตนาการไปสักเล็กน้อย แต่ก็ไม่ยากมากมายถึงขนาดไร้ซึ่งเหตุและผล ซึ่งถ้าคุณชอบเกมแนว Point & Click แนว Room Escape หรือชอบเกมแนว Surreal Horror คุณก็คงจะชอบเกมนี้

Rustry Lake Hotel เป็นเกม Flash เล็ก ๆ ราคาไม่แพงที่ผม "แนะนำเป็นอย่างยิ่ง" สำหรับใครก็ตามที่ชอบเกมแนว Point & Click ครับ คุณจะไม่ผิดหวังแน่นอนกับเงินทุกบาททุกสตางค์ที่ได้จ่ายออกไป

9 / 10

+ มันคือ Point & Click เล็ก ๆ ในระดับขึ้นหิ้งที่น่าเสียดายมีน้อยคนนักจะรู้จักและกล่าวถึง

หรือถ้า 49.- บาทฟังดูแพงเกินไปสำหรับเกม Flash เล็ก ๆ คุณสามารถสัมผัสกับผลงานก่อนหน้าของพวกเขาได้อย่างฟรี ๆ ได้ที่ www.rustylake.com

ปล. ผมขอมอบรางวัล "The Best Use of a Farm Animal Award" ของ Autumn Sales 2016 ให้แก่เกมนี้ :3

26334053.review:
Rusty Lake Hotel è senza dubbio un punta e clicca pieno di fascino, mistero e dall'atmosfera inquietante. Nato dai creatori della nota serie di punta e clicca online "cube escape" (giocabile per intero gratuitamente sul sito della rusty lake), il gioco ne condivide lo stile grafico ed il simbolismo caratteristico: chiunque abbia giocato le precedenti avventure infatti ritroverà in Rusty Lake Hotel molti collegamenti con queste, dalla struttura degli enigmi ai personaggi.
Lo stile di gioco è quello del più classico punta e clicca in flash: il gameplay consiste nel collezionare oggetti interagendoci col mouse combinandoli od utilizzandoli dove necessario per risolvere i vari enigmi che ci si pareranno in ogni livello (o meglio dire stanza). 
La difficoltà non è elevata, soprattutto per chi è amante del genere, ma sono comunque presenti enigmi dalla risoluzione "fantasiosa" che metteranno alla prova la vostra inventiva ed intuizione. Ed è proprio questo alone di surrealtà visionaria che conferisce al gioco un fascino tutto suo, un po' dark se vogliamo, regalando un'esperienza che descriverei sconcertante e "disturbante" ma in modo positivo. 
Il prezzo è veramente esiguo e personalmente non mi ha fatto pentire dell'acquisto ma l'esperienza di gioco sarà breve e la rigiocabilità quasi assente, giustificata magari giusto dalla voglia di collezionare per ogni livello il massimo dei punti, quindi affrontate l'acquisto tenendolo a mente e preparatevi ad essere accolti in Rusty Lake Hotel.

26202735.review:
[b][i]Rusty Lake Hotel[/i] is a cutely-dark point-and-click puzzle games where each room is its own set of puzzles with a distinct end-goal of killing the inhabitant.[/b] The price point is about right here, too, since I wouldn't pay much more for this. It could likely be a free flash game and I wouldn't know the difference. There is nothing horribly wrong with it, other than it is short and fairly one-dimensional as far as depth and complexity goes. It all feels very 'mobile' with the constant spam clicking.

[i]So what do you need to know?[/i] The puzzle solutions don't always make sense, this is usually a deal-breaker for point-and-click games with me, but here it is ok enough. For each room, you need to at least find the main 'ingrediant' (which is killing the room renter). For bragging rights you can find two other bonus items to really see everything. None of it is really all that difficult. This isn't [i]Myst[/i]. While there is little voice acting, what is present is actually really good. The story is something akin to what we could expect from a Wes Anderson and Tim Burton collaboration.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Cheap game that will entertain you for a day
+Quirky and dark little story that is interesting enough
+Artwork is nice, and fitting
+Some of the scenes are pretty cool (I liked when the boar was smoking opium)

[b]Cons:[/b]
-It all feels very mobile
-The on-screen arrows (left, right, back) should actually be 'buttons' proper so I know the boundaries of where I can click
-The puzzle solutions are not always logical, which is stupid

[b]I think it is worth two bucks, but barely.[/b] Will I keep playing the series? Yeah probably, since it is fun to sit around with a friend and work through it.

26096518.review:
"Rusty Lake Hotel" is a point and click puzzle game that has a disturbing underlining plot laced into it. Join for 5 nights to solve puzzles in your guests' rooms and to cook them a dish each night that they will die for. 

Each room is a whole puzzle to get what you ultamately came for [spoiler](their meat)[/spoiler], and to ensure the player to complete, it halts you from leaving the room. This can be appealing, as you know the solution is somewhere in the room, not having to run between rooms to get clues or objects. With each puzzle, it gives you enough clues for you to figure it out, but not too much to make it too easy. Each room has its own theme with the puzzles designed to correspond with the theme and the music different with each room. Depending on your puzzle solving skills, each room varies between completion times.
Not only does every room act as a whole puzzle, there are two puzzles that are active throughout the whole game, making the meals and a key puzzle. While making the meals perfectly can be difficult, the game does help with guiding you through the most effective way to get the ingredients, some requiring you to look closely and some requiring you to remember if the guest was drinking something. 
The negatives with Rusty Lake Hotel is the ending, especially to those not familiar with Rusty Lake's other works like I am. Another can be the length, but this game is very puzzle driven to progress, so the length may vary between person to person. 
Overall, Rusty Lake Hotel is a charming and surreal puzzle game that makes the most out of the time it has.

Instead, this game features 5 rooms and an overarching puzzle, with most of the rooms being slightly more elaborate and much more visually complex than the online games.

Much like the original game, this game has some flaws. Some puzzles require solutions that are slightly nonsensical (especially the bonus puzzles), and some of the moments fail to make an emotional impact. On the balance, though, it is a great addition to the series.

싱글 게임으로서의 볼륨은 그만큼 작은 편은 편이지요. (플레이하면서 The Lake나 Arles를 제외하고 다른 무료 시리즈보다도 분량이 짧다고 느꼈습니다.) 하지만  2천원이라는 가격이 아깝다거나 하지는 않습니다. 뭣보다도 저는 이전 게임들의 무료게임치고 훌륭한 퀄리티를 보고 믿고 지른 것이라 매우 만족스러웠습니다.

이 게임을 Cube Escape 시리즈의 처음으로 해 보신 분이라면 스토리가 심오하지만 인물이나 설정에 대해 잘 모르겠다-고 생각하실 수 있는데, 이 게임은 Cube Escape 시리즈와 긴밀히 연결된 게임입니다. Cube Escape 시리즈는 현재진행형이고, 아직 풀리지 않은 떡밥이 많이 있는데 이 게임은 시간적으로 따지면 본작의 프리퀄....이 되고, 본작에서 나타나는 일부의 인물이나 설정에 대해 알 수 있습니다.
